Hi all,

Just spotted this:

That the Delta-v was given at the node! handy for player's like me without mods

Wow, so many things no one has seen before. I already seen 3 different threads with new ideas! (No Sarcasm Intended or flaming, or being rude)

Edited May 31, 2013 by TheCanadianVendingMachine

Yep, and if you haven't seen yet, you can go to those two buttons with the pod and kerbal icon and they will give you information on your vessel. If you use the tab key or double click to switch to the Mun (Or any other celestial body) it will also give information on those! These details include radius, atmospheric height, surface gravity, and many more!
Also, for those that haven't seen it/noticed it when you click on something (vessel) on the map it gives the option to set as target or switch to. Pretty handy sometimes.
Now if only the estimated burn time worked all the time.
And when you in iva, there is a altitude meter that shows you your altitude above terrain When you are closer than 3000 meter.

And when you in iva, there is a altitude meter that shows you your altitude above terrain When you are closer than 3000 meter.

That one has been a life-saver (literally) on a few missions although I do still look at the Radar Altimeter out of sheer force of habit when doing an IVA (read: show-off) landing. I completely missed the Delta-V predictions on nodes. Its a lovely touch. The new "Switch To" option is the one I use the most as I'm a bit of a station building fiend.

Here's another one: clicking the AP and PE markers on your orbital path "pins" the value to your map screen until you click it again so you can make adjustments to your nodes without having to constantly go hover over the markers to see your changes.

OH GOD!!! Thanks so much! That is the only thing on this thread that I did not know about!!!
This update had a lot of little, hidden gems. It's real neat really.
